name: Hilton Garden Inn Arcadia / Pasadena Area

reviews.text: I spent several months in and out of here in the fall of 2005. The whole place is pretty nice. Rooms, pool, excercise room, breakfast. But it is not the best value in the area. I prefer its sister property, the Hampton, which is actually cheaper.
reviews.title: Nice, but a Little Pricey
Very nice business hotel
reviews.text: In some ways, this is much like any in the Hilton chain the Arcadia area (Embassy Suites, Hampton Inn, and Hilton Garden Inn all within about a block of one another), but the room is slightly larger and more plush in a number of ways than the Hampton Inn. It is perhaps not quite as nice as the Embassy Suites, but the heating and air conditioning controls are infinitely superior. (When I stayed in the Embassy Suites, my room had a thermostat, but I eventually learned from the front desk that it did not work at all, and could only be used to make the room colder regardless of how you set the thermostat. A little odd.) The breakfast packages are worth the little extra that they cost.

reviews.title: A Little Out of the Way, But Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: We stayed here in July 2004. Keep in mind that this is a Garden Inn and not a full Hilton. It was very clean, the room was nice sized with 2 dbl. beds, nice sized bathroom, refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. No complaints It was a little far to travel back and forth to LA each day, but if I was in the area again, I would definitely consider this hotel.

reviews.title: Average Room, Great Service
reviews.text: The hotel looks very nice from the outside, but the rooms are very average. I found the bed uncomfortable and hated the decorating. However, the breakfast was very good and the lobby was open and airy. I'll look for other area Hilton properties to stay before returning.

reviews.title: Arcadia Hilton Garden Inn
reviews.text: I spent a couple of nights at this property. It is practically brand new. Everything is clean and well-tended to. While they do not offer a continental breakfast they have a deli where you can get whatever you need provided you don't mind paying an arm and a leg for it. There are restaurants nearby including a Denny's where you can get a nice breakfast. The room is decent-sized, comfortable, and has a refrigerator. The biggest difficulty I had was finding the hotel. The street where it is located is off Huntington Drive, a very windy road and it is easy to get confused. I had difficulty getting directions from the front desk agent when I was lost. Bottom line, if you are going there, get detailed directions from someone physically at the hotel. Get landmarks. Arcadia is a cute little town. Enjoy your stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very convenient for the Pasadena area. It is very well run. The staff are friendly and the rooms and general accomodation are very good. There is an excellent complimentary breakfast. It is reasonably priced and there are plenty of restaurants close by. The hotel is in a good area and is just of the Interstate.
reviews.title: Close to Pasadena

reviews.text: BEWARE! Do not stay in this crappy hotel......
reviews.title: Stolen Item

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel through a recommendation from my brother-in-law to attend a wedding in July 2006. After the party we came back at the hotel and trying to look for the retainer and it's missing. I talked to the front desk agent and asked for the General Manager's name to let him know that my retainer is missing from the bathroom countertop. I emailed Mr. RICHARD WORSHAM regarding this problem and HE ignored my emails and receipt to get a reimbursement for the retainers. Room cleaner are too busy picking up things that doesn't belong to them. I'm very upset, frustrated and stress about this.
reviews.title: Too much customer Service, bad service

likes.liked: — Too much contact with staff, bad service at the breakfast

reviews.text: I hope I will get a response from Mr. Richard Worsham and settle this matter.
